idiom.meaning: Cherish something too much to put it down
idiom.example: She couldn't put down the antique jade pendant, examining it from every angle

shortDescription: Song Dynasty connoisseurs first used this phrase to describe loving something so much (爱) one cannot (不) release (释) it from hand (手).
